author: Ralph Ellison
title: Invisible Man
description: A masterpiece. The way he folds such vivid imagery into clear-eyed explorations of identity, philosophy, politics. His pacing of ascension and collapse - riveting from cover to cover.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: Ficciones
description: Mathematics, dreams, poetry, mystery, philosophy. The instant I read these works, I dissolved into the labyrinthine worlds of Borges and I have yet to return.

author: Flannery O'Connor
title: The Complete Stories
description: Growing up in Texas, I could relate to the southern setting of these short stories. What astonishes and amazes is her unusual, poignant blend of violence and grace.

author: Walt Whitman
title: Leaves of Grass
description: I spent the better part of a year climbing various trees, reading these poems, tucked away in the branches. Hard to find a more optimistic, passionate voice in poetry.

author: Langston Hughes
title: The Weary Blues
description: Langston's voice is utterly unique - vibrant, strongly metaphoric, richly democratic. Some of the most powerful, beautiful and memorable lines I've ever read.

author: Stephen Dunn
title: The Insistence of Beauty
description: Something about his writing lulls me into a kind of familiarity, the casual way he delights. An absolute master of this poetic craft.

author: Denis Johnson
title: Train Dreams
description: An unsettling portrait of a man in the shifting American West, lyrical and desolate, frank and mystical. The story sedates me, carries me off in a bizarre sense of wonder.

author: T.S. Eliot
title: Four Quartets
description: This booklength poem is as intriguing and mystifying as any piece of writing. Read it again and again. Its depth and challenge will enlighten you with every pass.

author: Tim Seibles
title: Fast Animal
description: His works are a reminder that poetry is meant to be spoken and heard. It is something active, passionate, a moving expression and exhortation.

author: Mary Oliver
title: Upstream: Selected Essays
description: An excellent poet, easily in my top 5 all-time. These essays revealed so much about her life, her philosophy, her deep communion with nature - grateful for her sharing such insight.
